intro: Epidendrum violodora, commonly known as the violet orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It features striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a subtle iridescence. The plant has long, slender pseudobulbs and linear,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity and well-draining potting media. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in greenhouses.
